<h3> UL Safety Index <br>
<h5> Some countries may be missing due to technical difficulties <br><br>
<iframe width="80%" height="580px" src="attach/UL/ul_safety_index_map.html" frameBorder="0" scrolling="yes"></iframe><br></center>

<div class = "code1">
<p style = "text-align: left;">
```{r, eval = FALSE}
# This map was created using the googleVis package
library(googleVis)
library(pwt8)

ul_colors = list(colors="['#F5A064', '#B70030', '#610039']")
Geo.map <- gvisGeoChart(ul_dataset, 
                        locationvar = "Country", 
                        colorvar = "Safety Index", 
                        options = list(width = "100%", height = 550,
                                     colors = ul_colors))
plot(Geo.map)
Geo.map$html$chart
cat(Geo.map$html$chart, file = "ul_safety_index_map.html")

ul_table <- gvisTable(ul_table,
                      options=list(width = "100%", height = 550))

ul_index_map <- gvisMerge(ul_table, Geo.map, horizontal = TRUE) # Combining table and map
ul_index_map$html$chart
cat(ul_index_map$html$chart, file="ul_safety_index_map.html")
```
</p></div><br><br>

<center>
<h4><div class="newspaper1">
<p style="text-align: justify;">
<h4> Today, I will be analyzing the global safety index created by the scientists at the Underwriters Laboratories ([click here](http://www.ulsafetyindex.org/app/#view/map) for the data). The Underwriters Laboratories Safety Index is comprised of three drivers: Safety Outcomes, Safety Framework, and Institutions & Resources, each driver measured by sixteen indicators. <br><br><br> </p></div>
